reviews.review_msg: 3.5/5, but I couldn't choose that. His lectures might be a bit boring, but he is very reasonable with his grading, willing to help, and his course has a relatively small workload. Put in some effort into understanding the theory, and you will do fine.

Good course overall but the lectures could be a bit dry. The material itself wasn't too hard but there was just a lot of it covered every lecture, make sure you allow time to review notes and/or take your own so you fully understand everything.
